page.title: 10TRADE IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The Crown Inn is the only surviving public house in Trelawnyd, and is situated on the main road. In the summer season it provides lunch time food. A small percentage of its customers reside in Trelawnyd, though the Crown is undoubtedly a major meeting place. The landlord enjoys playing a leading role in the community life through organising a wide variety of fund raising events. He has raised approximately Â£900 per annum for local causes, e.g. Village School, Hospital Appeal, Village Hall. The landlord, with the help of his customers, annually provides a bus for O.A.P.'s outings. They also arrange a free Fire work Display and celebrate fully any special day with a carnival atmosphere.The Crown Inn runs various competitions and quizzes.
